title: Nitish Kumar Reddy given free food, clothes, accommodation; dad requested ex-BCCI selector: 'He came to me and said...' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Nitish Kumar Reddy Achieves Historic Century in Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: December 28, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Nitish Kumar Reddy made headlines by scoring his first Test century against Australia, leading his team from a precarious position to a celebrated win.

  • Reddy scored a pivotal century against a challenging bowling attack including Pat Cummins and Mitchell Starc.
  • MSK Prasad, former chief selector, expressed deep emotional pride regarding Reddy's performance.
  • Reddy’s father felt overwhelmed, witnessing his son's remarkable achievement from the stands.
  • Reddy has consistently performed well in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, showcasing his potential as a rising star.
  • MSK Prasad highlighted how Reddy was groomed through systematic training from a young age.
“I think he stepped up to the occasion... He has raised his level and made a mark.” - MSK Prasad

This monumental achievement not only reflects Reddy's hard work and perseverance but also sets the stage for a promising future in international cricket.
newTitle: Nitish Kumar Reddy Achieves Historic Century in Boxing Day Test

title: Knocks him over! Bumrah ensures Konstas no-show in second innings at MCG - Watch - The Times of India
summary:
Bumrah Dismisses Konstas in Second Innings at MCG

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

The law of averages caught up with Australia's opener Sam Konstas in the second innings of his Test career, as his stumps were rattled by Jasprit Bumrah early on Day 4 of the fourth Test in Melbourne.

  • Sam Konstas scored 8 runs in his second innings after a breezy 60 in the first innings.
  • India's first innings concluded at 369 runs, with Nitish Kumar Reddy being the last wicket to fall at 114 runs, dismissed by Nathan Lyon.
  • Australia took a 105-run lead before the second innings began.
  • Bumrah's delivery that dismissed Konstas moved sharply and hit the top of middle-stump.
  • Mohammed Siraj later took another wicket, dismissing Usman Khawaja.
Washington Sundar: 'Nitish Reddy is fire, not flower; he killed it today'

Overall, it was a strong performance by the Indian bowlers, setting the stage for an interesting continuation of the match.
newTitle: Bumrah Dismisses Konstas in Second Innings at MCG

title: Koneru Humpy becomes 2024 FIDE Women’s World Rapid Champion - Deccan Herald
summary:
Koneru Humpy Becomes 2024 FIDE Women’s World Rapid Champion

Published: 29 December 2024, Source: New York

India’s Koneru Humpy secured her second World Rapid Chess Championship title by defeating Irene Sukandar of Indonesia. This victory solidifies her position as a leading player in women’s chess.

  • Humpy finished the tournament with a remarkable score of 8.5 out of 11 points.
  • She previously won the championship in 2019, making her only the second player to achieve this feat multiple times.
  • Despite challenges, including a first-round loss and difficulties with the time difference, Humpy expressed her surprise and happiness at winning.
  • Her victory further contributes to India's recent successes in international chess.
  • Humpy hopes her achievement will inspire more young Indians to pursue chess professionally.
“I think this will motivate a lot of youngsters to take up chess professionally,” said Humpy.

The event underscores a remarkable year for Indian chess, following D Gukesh’s recent classical championship win and historic gold medals at the Chess Olympiad.
newTitle: Koneru Humpy Wins 2024 FIDE Women’s World Rapid Chess Championship

title: Drama at MCG! Pat Cummins denied review on Mohammed Siraj call; Ravi Shastri, Adam Gilchrist left stunned - The Times of India
summary:
Drama at MCG! Pat Cummins denied review on Mohammed Siraj call; Ravi Shastri, Adam Gilchrist left stunned

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Australian captain Pat Cummins was perplexed after the third umpire overturned what appeared to be a legitimate dismissal during the Boxing Day Test at the MCG.

  • Cummins delivered a full-length delivery to Mohammed Siraj, leading to a contentious call on a catch by Steve Smith.
  • The third umpire ruled Siraj not out, citing unclear evidence of a bump ball.
  • Cummins requested a review of the decision but was denied by the on-field umpires.
  • The decision confused commentators Adam Gilchrist and Ravi Shastri, who questioned the umpiring process.
  • Australia dismissed Nitish Kumar Reddy shortly after the controversy.
This is very interesting. I have never seen this before. - Adam Gilchrist
The umpire said I've seen the ball bounce after it hit the bat. That was a very quick call. - Ravi Shastri

The controversial call had little impact on the match outcome, with India trailing Australia by 105 runs after their first innings.
newTitle: Drama at MCG! Pat Cummins denied review on Mohammed Siraj call; Ravi Shastri, Adam Gilchrist left stunned

title: 'Calm down': Ravi Shastri on Rishabh Pant's bizarre dismissal at MCG - The Times of India
summary:
Calm down: Ravi Shastri on Rishabh Pant's bizarre dismissal at MCG

Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

In a crucial phase of Day 3 at the MCG, Rishabh Pant's risky shot selection led to his dismissal, sparking debate among fans and experts about his aggressive playing style.

  • Pant attempted a scoop shot against Scott Boland but was caught out, leaving India at 191/5.
  • Criticism of Pant's shot selection included comments from cricketer Sunil Gavaskar, who labeled it “stupid.”
  • Ravi Shastri defended Pant, suggesting that it’s important to assess the context of his dismissals across innings.
  • Shastri emphasized the need for Pant to adapt his approach during matches and play with maturity.
“It's not in every innings he has attempted that shot... Let’s calm down here, guys. It’s not every time he’s throwing it away.” - Ravi Shastri

Shastri also remarked on Pant's propensity for high-risk shots, noting that while they can be effective, they must be executed wisely in changing game situations.
newTitle: Ravi Shastri Defends Rishabh Pant’s Dismissal at MCG

title: Carlsen Quits Rapid & Blitz Championships; Murzin, Duda, Arjun, Grischuk Lead Open - Chess.com
summary:
Carlsen Withdraws from Rapid & Blitz Championships Amid Dress Code Dispute

Date: December 27, 2024   Source: Chess.com

In a surprising turn of events, GM Magnus Carlsen announced he will no longer compete in the 2024 FIDE World Rapid Chess Championship due to a disagreement with the dress code enforced by FIDE.

  • Carlsen finished the rapid tournament with a score of 5/8.
  • This exit guarantees the crowning of new champions in both rapid and blitz formats.
  • Four players, including Volodar Murzin, Jan-Krzysztof Duda, Arjun Erigaisi, and Alexander Grischuk, lead the open championship with scores of 7/9.
  • Disputes over fines were reported, highlighting inconsistencies in dress code enforcement.
"My patience with them was not very big to begin with... then I'm out, then f**k you." — Magnus Carlsen

As the championships move forward, all eyes will be on the new emerging talents in rapid and blitz chess.
newTitle: Carlsen Withdraws from Rapid & Blitz Championships Amid Dress Code Dispute

title: Magnus Carlsen breaks silence after quitting World Chess Championship over shocking jeans row: ‘Honestly, I am…’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Magnus Carlsen Walks Out of Championship Over Jeans Controversy

Date: Dec 28, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

The world champion Magnus Carlsen left the World Rapid and Blitz Chess Championships after being told he could not compete in jeans.

  • Carlsen was in New York for the championship when he was informed about the dress code violation.
  • He initially offered to change his jeans for the next day but was fined and told to change immediately.
  • After being prohibited from participating, Carlsen famously expressed his frustration and walked out.
  • Carlsen stated he would not appeal the ruling, citing his age and indifference to the situation.
  • The head of FIDE clarified that Carlsen was not disqualified and could continue in the tournament the next day.
“Honestly, I am too old at this point to care too much.” – Magnus Carlsen

Carlsen’s departure adds a dramatic twist to this year’s championship and raises questions about the enforcement of dress codes in professional chess.
newTitle: Magnus Carlsen Leaves Chess Championship Over Dress Code Dispute

title: PM Modi calls chess champion Gukesh an embodiment of calmness, humility - Business Standard
summary:
PM Modi Meets Chess World Champion Gukesh, Praises His Determination and Humility

Date: December 28, 2024
Source: Times of India

Prime Minister Narendra Modi met with newly-crowned chess world champion D Gukesh and praised the 18-year-old for his determination, dedication, and humility.

  1. Gukesh became the youngest chess world champion, surpassing Garry Kasparov's record.
  2. PM Modi met with Gukesh and his parents, commending their efforts in his journey to the world title.
  3. Gukesh gifted PM Modi the chessboard used in his winning game.

Had an excellent interaction with chess champion and India’s pride, @DGukesh!  I have been closely interacting with him for a few years now, and what strikes me most about him is his determination and dedication. His confidence is truly inspiring.

In fact, I recall seeing a video of his few years ago where he had said he would become the youngest world champion - a prediction that has now clearly come true thanks to his own efforts.

Along with confidence, Gukesh embodies calmness and humility. Upon winning, he was composed, basking in his glory while fully understanding how to process this hard-earned victory. Our conversation today revolved around the transformative potential of yoga and meditation.

In the success of every athlete, their parents play a pivotal role. I complimented Gukesh's parents for supporting him through thick and thin. Their dedication will inspire countless parents of young aspirants who dream of pursuing sports as a career.

I am also delighted to have received from Gukesh the original chessboard from the game he won. The chessboard, autographed by both him and Ding Liren, is a cherished memento.

After the meeting, Gukesh expressed his gratitude and humility towards the PM's support and encouragement.
newTitle: PM Modi Meets Chess World Champion Gukesh, Praises His Determination and Humility

title: 'We followed the rules, Magnus Carlsen didn't': FIDE deputy prez Viswanathan Anand - The Times of India
summary:
Chess World Reacts to Magnus Carlsen's Breach of Rules: Anand Speaks Out

Published on October 12, 2023, in Times of India

In a surprising turn of events, five-time world chess champion Magnus Carlsen has been accused of breaking tournament rules, sparking a wave of reactions from the chess community. The World Chess Federation (FIDE) deputy president, Viswanathan Anand, has spoken out against Carlsen's actions.

  1. Carlsen was seen playing a rapid game on a different platform while participating in the Sinquefield Cup.
  2. This breach of rules has led to widespread discussion and criticism in the chess community.
  3. Anand, a former world champion himself, has criticized Carlsen's actions, stating that they disrespect the tournament and fellow players.

“We followed the rules, Magnus Carlsen didn’t. It’s as simple as that.” - Viswanathan Anand

Carlsen's actions have ignited a debate about sportsmanship and the integrity of chess tournaments. While some support Carlsen's right to express himself, others argue that his actions set a poor example for younger players.
newTitle: Chess World Reacts to Magnus Carlsen's Breach of Rules: Anand Speaks Out

title: "Even if Virat Kohli would have turned Usain Bolt, he wouldn't have crossed the half-way mark": Ravi Shastri on Yashasvi Jaiswal's run-out debate - Crictoday

  • Shastri criticized Jaiswal's judgment in the incident, stating Kohli could not have made it even if he had sprinted.
  • The run-out came at a crucial moment, impacting India’s batting order.
“Yashasvi Jaiswal didn’t realise how quickly the ball went to Pat Cummins. Pat is really fast in that area. Even if Virat Kohli would have turned Usain Bolt, he wouldn’t have crossed the half-way mark. This was a clear error in judgement by Jaiswal.” - Ravi Shastri

This incident highlights the fine line between aggressive batting and careful judgment in cricket.

title: 'Nitish Reddy’s first-class average is 22': Sanjay Manjrekar marvels at youngster's knock - The Times of India
summary:

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Times of India

Nitish Kumar Reddy's remarkable performance in the fourth Test against Australia has drawn acclaim from former cricket stars, showcasing his ability to excel despite a modest first-class average.

  • Nitish Reddy scored an unbeaten 105 runs from 176 balls, contributing significantly to India's total of 358/9 by the end of Day 3.
  • His partnership with Washington Sundar was pivotal, worth 127 runs for the eighth wicket.
  • Former cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar expressed amazement at Reddy's maturity, noting his first-class average of only 22.
  • Other cricketers, including Irfan Pathan, highlighted the historic nature of the partnership between Reddy and Sundar, which endured over 300 deliveries.
  • Reddy's performance provides hope for India's prospects in Test cricket.
“There has never been an instance where the number 8 and 9 batsman in the Indian team have played over 300 deliveries.” - Irfan Pathan

Reddy's innings is seen as a significant step for Indian cricket, combining technique and determination to inspire future generations of players.
